revised_title: Sorption of Simple Paraffins in Decationated Zeolites: Chabazite and Zeolite L
tldr: The authors studied the sorption of simple paraffins in decationated zeolites, specifically chabazite and zeolite L. They determined thermodynamic equilibrium constants, activity coefficients, and heats, entropies, and free energies of sorption for the paraffins. The results showed differences in isosteric heats between hydrogen and calcium-rich chabazite, but not between hydrogen and potassium forms of zeolite L. The study provides insights into the role of sorption in cracking and reforming hydrocarbons using zeolite catalysts.
